column172: This survey did not ask about a base line - for example, I already grow some of my own vegetables, have excellent insulation, solar on the roof, live in a double brick home, drive a small sedan, recycle and sudsave washing water for the garden, own three compost bins to reduce waste, donate \'waste\' to local schools for recycling, rarely buy new clothes, and have as many water wise plants that I can in the house and yard to improve the air quality. I also supply plants free to others. If every person does a small amount this will help our country - it doesn't have to cost a lot, just a bit of thought and preparation. On a bigger scale it is silly to have electric vehicles in Australia. When we visit family in NSW it is an 8000 km round trip - electric vehicles cannot go for up to 1400 km per day as my current vehicle does, so this would necessitate our flying. Big picture - why is the temperature on Mars also increasing??? Some countries cannot afford to make as many changes as others, but they should not be disadvantaged. However it is unfair to tax other countries in order to help them.
